bioghist.p: Karl Dittmer (d. 1994) was Dean of the College of Science at Portland State University. From 1958 to 1964, he was also the Program Administrator of the Petroleum Research Fund, a trust established by seven major oil companies in 1944 to foster "advanced scientific education and fundamental research in the 'petroleum field.'" This fund was administered by the American Chemical Society.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a manuscript copy of the report (including appendices) that Dittmer prepared in 1979 detailing the Petroleum Research Fund's Education and Research Grants Program.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
